notes: Ullmark has a strain and is without a timetable to return but is not expected to be out long.
Seguin is considered day-to-day and is out on Tuesday (Oct. 15) versus the San Jose Sharks.
Edmundson missed practice on Tuesday and is questionable for Wednesday (Oct. 16) versus Toronto.
Nylander will be a game-time decision on Wednesday (Oct. 16) versus the Los Angeles Kings.
Gudbranson suffered a upper-body injury and did not return to Tuesday's (Oct. 15) matchup versus the Florida Panthers.
Roy will be out of action for some games despite a day-to-day designation. Head coach Spencer Carbery told reporters Monday, per Tarik El-Bashir of Monumental Sports Network.
Zub suffered an upper-body injury and did not return to Monday's (Oct. 14) matchup versus the Los Angeles Kings.
Durzi will be out for the foreseeable future and is without a timetable to return.
Fischer did not play in Monday's (Oct. 14) game against the New York Rangers.
Eriksson Ek did not play in Tuesday's (Oct. 15) game against the St. Louis Blues.
Greig is expected to miss a week or two, according to Bruce Garrioch of Postmedia.
Spurgeon did not play in Tuesday's (Oct. 15) game against the St. Louis Blues.
Johansson did not play in Tuesday (Oct. 15) versus the St. Louis Blues.
Dumba is out week-to-week, per Dallas Stars beat writer Sam Nestler.
Tkachuk did not play in Tuesday's (Oct. 15) game against Columbus.
Tavares returned to practice in full on Tuesday (Oct. 15), per Lance Hornby.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Nick Seeler on injured reserve.
Drouin is dealing with an upper-body injury and will miss the next few games, Ryan Boulding of NHL.com reports.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Macklin Celebrini on injured reserve.
The St Louis Blues placed F Alexandre Texier on injured reserve.
Barkov is expected to miss 2-3 weeks but could return before the team travels to Finland for the NHL Global Series in November. Jameson Olive of the Panthers' official site reports.
The Calgary Flames placed F Kevin Rooney on injured reserve.
Petry did not play in Monday's (Oct. 14) game against the New York Rangers.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list.
Lemieux is dealing with an undisclosed injury and is going to be out a while, coach Rod Brind'Amour told Cory Lavalette of the North State Journal.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed G Joseph Woll on injured reserve.
The Montreal Canadiens placed F Jacob Perreault on injured reserve.
The Utah Hockey Club placed Douglas on injured reserve.
Struble did not play in Monday's (Oct. 14) game versus the Pittsburgh Penguins.

The Utah Hockey Club placed F Sam Lipkin on injured reserve.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jakub Demek on injured reserve non-roster list.
The Tampa Bay Lightning placed F Gabriel Fortier on injured reserve non-roster list.
Anderson-Dolan was summoned from the minors and placed on injured reserve.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jordan Gustafson on injured reserve non-roster list.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He has not appeared in a game since 2022.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Adam Beckman on injured reserve.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Fraser Minten on the Injured Reserve.
The San Jose Sharks placed D Lucas Carlsson on Injured Reserved.

The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Connor Dewar on the Injured Reserve.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Matthew Highmore on injured reserve.
Clarke is expected to miss about a month with a lower-body injury, Dylan Loucks of The Hockey News reports Saturday.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Jordan Dumais on injured reserve.
The St. Louis Blues placed F Simon Robertsson on the Injured Reserve.
The Carolina Hurricanes placed D Riley Stillman on injured reserve.
Danforth participated in a full practice on Friday, Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site reports.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Roby Jarventie on injured reserve.
The Calgary Flames placed F Yegor Sharangovich (lower body) on the Injured Reserve.
Jenner underwent shoulder surgery Wednesday and could return before the end of the season, Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site reports.
The Detroit Red Wings placed F Tim Gettinger on the injured reserve non-roster list.
Peterka will be a 50/50 call ahead of Wednesday's (Oct. 16) matchup with Pittsburgh, Bill Hoppe of the Olean Times Herald reports.
The Buffalo Sabres placed Nicolas Aube-Kubel on injured reserve.
The Florida Panthers placed F Justin Sourdif on injured reserve.
Campbell will be away from the Red Wings for an indefinite period of time after it was announced Friday that he has entered the NHL/NHLPA Player Assistance Program.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Calle Jarnkrok on the Injured Reserve.
Karlsson is not expected to travel on the Golden Knights' upcoming three-game road trip.
Per Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site, F Voronkov will not require surgery, general manager Don Waddell.
Brindley has been placed on injured reserve and is expected to miss 4 to 6 weeks.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery to repair a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Blake Lizotte on injured reserve.
The Montral Canadiens placed F Patrik Laine on injured reserve.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Vasily Ponomarev on injured reserve.
Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee this morning and is out 5-to-6 months.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed G Alex Nedeljkovic on injured reserve.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve..
Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery and is without a timetable to return.
The Anaheim Ducks placed G John Gibson on injured reserve.

Kaliyev is out indefinitely after suffering a fractured clavicle.
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Ville Heinola on the Injured Reserve.
The Chicago Blackhawks placed D Artyom Levshunov on season-opening injured reserve.
The Vancouver Canucks placed G Thatcher Demko on the injured reserve non-roster list.
Marino is still week-to-week with an upper-body injury, per Cole Bagley of Daily Faceoff-Fantasy.
The St. Louis Blues placed F Oskar Sundqvist on the Injured Reserve.
Bjugstad will be listed as week-to-week and is not taking part in the start of training camp, per Craig Morgan of ALLCITY Network.
Pesce was placed on injured reserve, according to PuckPedia.
The San Jose Sharks placed D Shakir Mukhamadullin on injured reserve.
Vlasic is hopeful he will return in a couple of weeks, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Logan Couture on injured reserve.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Matt Nieto on the long-term injured reserve.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Evander Kane on long-term injured reserve.
Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury that's expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
Joshua will join the Canucks on their upcoming four-game road trip and could start skating during that time, Farhan Lalji of TSN reports.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Artturi Lehkonen on the Injured Reserve.
The New Jersey Devils placed Luke Hughes on injured reserve.
Krug will undergo surgery on his left ankle and will miss the entire 2024-25 season.
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Jesper Fast on long-term injured reserve.
Brossoit was placed on season-opening injured reserve, Mario Tirabassi of CHGO Sports reports.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Igor Chernyshov on Injured Reserved.
Harvey-Pinard was placed on long-term injured reserve, per PuckPedia.
Nichushkin was placed in Stage 3 of the NHL/NHLPA player assistance program and suspended for a minimum of six months without pay for violating the terms of Stage 2, the NHL and NHLPA announced.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Gabriel Landeskog on long-term injured reserve.
